author: EXM7777
text:
i gained 38k followers and 35M+ impressions in 6 months...

here's the exact process i used to write 7 tweets per day in 30 minutes:

look, i don't like forcing creative work, sitting at my desk hoping my brain magically produces tweet ideas sucks

so i stopped trying (never really tried)

instead... i just scribble down whatever happens during my day in a notebook, then turn those thoughts into formatted tweets in the evening

the easiest way to produce content in volume is simple: DO things

if you're learning something new every day, solving problems, doing cool shit... it's really not complicated to turn your life into tweets

here's how you can do the same:

spend more time exploring new concepts and talk about what you're learning - this works because you tap into genuine questions people have as they're learning the same stuff

you're not pretending to be an expert... you're just sharing what clicked for you

document your business: systems you set up, problems your clients have, workflows that worked - this works because you define yourself as an authority and connect with people facing the same challenges

shitpost - it's easy to tweet about random stuff that comes to mind

the whole process should feel natural: scribble down thoughts on paper as things happen and then scratch your head a little to turn raw observations into polished tweets

that's it

ask yourself "what did o figure out today that someone else might find useful?"
